TypeSignature.Value: .class public sealed serializable ThreadPriority extends System.Enum
.class public auto ansi serializable sealed ThreadPriority extends System.Enum

summary.para: Specifies the scheduling priority of a .

remarks.para: values specify the relative scheduling priority of threads.

Operating systems are not guaranteed to support preemptive scheduling. Also, the concept of "thread priority" might not exist at all or its meaning might vary, depending on the underlying operating system. Implementers of this type are required to describe how the notion of thread priority maps to operating system priority. For more information about threads, see the class.

The property sets and returns the priority value information for a thread. Applications can request a scheduling priority for a thread by setting the property to the appropriate
value. The default thread priority is .

para.block: A thread cannot be scheduled if it is in the state or the state.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Threading.ThreadPriority AboveNormal = 3
.field public static literal valuetype System.Threading.ThreadPriority AboveNormal = int32(3)

summary.para: Threads with this priority can be scheduled after threads with priority and before those with priority.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Threading.ThreadPriority BelowNormal = 1
.field public static literal valuetype System.Threading.ThreadPriority BelowNormal = int32(1)

summary.para: Threads with this priority can be scheduled after threads with priority, and before those with priority.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Threading.ThreadPriority Highest = 4
.field public static literal valuetype System.Threading.ThreadPriority Highest = int32(4)

para.SPAN: Threads with this priority can be scheduled before threads with any other priority.

.field public static literal valuetype System.Threading.ThreadPriority Lowest = int32(0)

para.SPAN: Threads with this priority can be scheduled after threads with any other priority.
